result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaiah R Powell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to any other sentence, credit for 197 days time served.

- Restitution set at $0. 
- Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.
- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections; balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision; any unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.

- No possession of firearms.
- Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah R Powell

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Isaiah R Powell in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Isaiah R Powell.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a plea/sentencing hearing. State filed an amended information; defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY to the amended information.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered Habitual Criminality Repeater Enhancer is DISMISSED.

Court advised defendant if they are not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, they could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 

As to Count 1:  The court sentenced the defendant to a maximum term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 3 years and 6 months, concurrent to any other sentence, credit for 197 days time served, the term of initial confinement is 18 months, the term of extended supervision is 2 years. 

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Conditions of Extended Supervision
- Provide DNA Sample
- No possession of firearms
- Restitution set at $0. 
- Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.
- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections; balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision; any unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.  

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief, 20 day appeal rights given.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. 

Filed:
- Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Isaiah R Powell not in court, in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Due to the courts calendar congestion this matter needs to be adjourned. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Isaiah R Powell in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Isaiah R Powell in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel does not have file in court and request an additional hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Received & Filed, Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING (16 pages) commencing 03/08/2022 by Danielle N. Holcomb.

Defendant Isaiah R Powell in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Isaiah R Powell in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appeared by video means due to Covid-19 protocol.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding Felony armed robbery case #13CF2928.  Sworn for the State: Police Officer Mathew Jackson.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Isaiah R Powell in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Isaiah R Powell in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 38.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
